column4: all right, what's the deal with upgrading to Dapper through the Update Manager?
I can't get this to work at all.
what can't you get to work?
I click "Check", it says my system is up to date.
and I do have the newest Update Manager.
where do you click check?  what applications aren't working?
in the Update Manager, as explained on the wiki.
I'm still missing the big picture.  what is happening that shouldn't happen?
that should upgrade my system, or so the wiki claims.
in reality, nothing happens.
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DapperUpgrades <-- "Upgrading with the Update Manager"
gksudo update-manager -d
what's that do?
Your system is up-to-date
grep dapper /etc/apt/sources.list
nothing.
edit that file.  change all the  'breezy'  into  'dapper'    then  sudo apt-get update
great, I installed Ubuntu so I wouldn't have to edit files in /etc/.

the instructions in that document, *should* install a new breezy version of update-manager;  which then should allow you to upgrade the distribution to dapper.  did you restart the application after install the new version of update-manager?
several times.
what version of update-manager do you have installed?   Can you find out the version?
I also checked with synaptic that I've got the newest version.
getting any messages back yet?
